fresh_translation.text: Nicodemus was still confused and said to Jesus, "How can an old person be born again? Can they go back into their mom's tummy to be born again?" First, they believe in me, and that helps them know God better. When they believe, God's Spirit changes them inside. Baptism shows that they want to follow me and shows everyone their new life. This is how we start fresh with God, and it means we can be with Him forever!"

related_verses.text: Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.

Those who accepted his message were baptized, and about three thousand were added to their number that day.
We were therefore buried with him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new life.
This water symbolizes baptism that now saves you alsonot the removal of dirt from the body but the pledge of a clear conscience toward God.

translation_notes: I need to ensure that the updated translation is simple, direct, and appropriate for a seven-year-old. The focus should be on the act of baptism and its significance in following Jesus, while making the connection to John's role clearer. I'll also use consistent terminology related to baptism and the idea of repentance.

fresh_translation.text: At the same time, John the Baptist was in a place called Aenon, near Salim, where there was lots of water. Many people came to John to be baptized because they wanted to show they were sorry for the wrong things they did. This was their way of saying they wanted to be friends with God and follow Jesus. Being baptized was special because it showed they believed in Jesus and wanted to live the way God wants. John helped them promise to be part of Gods family and to be ready for what Jesus was teaching everyone.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse doesn't need to come before the previous one; it provides additional information about John the Baptist that follows logically after discussing his activities.

related_verses.text: They confessed their sins and were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
So John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
John said to the crowds coming out to be baptized by him, "You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
I baptize with water, John replied, "but among you stands one you do not know.
Paul said, "John's baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus."

translation_notes: To revise the translation of JHN 3:24 effectively for a seven-year-old, I will incorporate specific references to the context (Aenon and water), clarify the importance of repentance and baptism, and ensure a direct connection between John's teachings and Jesus. I will maintain simplicity while emphasizing the relationship with God and Jesus, minimizing repetition and ensuring the message aligns with conservative Christian teachings.

fresh_translation.text: At that time, John the Baptist was in a place called Aenon, near Salim, where there was a lot of water. He was still teaching people about God and helping them get ready to follow Jesus because many came to him, feeling sorry for the wrong things they did. They wanted to show God they loved Him and start fresh. When they were baptized in the water, it was a special way to say they wanted to be close to God again. John helped them understand how to follow God's way and be part of His family. John hadnt been put in prison yet.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse stands alone in context and does not require rearranging with the previous verse to maintain its meaning.

related_verses.text: The next day John was there again with two of his disciples.

John answered them all, saying, 'I baptize you with water. But one who is more powerful than I will come, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.'
I baptize you with water for repentance. But after me comes one who is more powerful than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
Paul said, 'John's baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus.'
They came to John and said to him, 'Rabbi, that man who was with you on the other side of the Jordanthe one you testified aboutlook, he is baptizing, and everyone is going to him.'

translation_notes: I will revise the translation of John 3:25 to be more concise while ensuring that the main ideas are clearly expressed for a seven-year-old. I'll maintain focus on the key elements of baptism and its significance, while also ensuring the context of the conversation between John the Baptist's disciples and the Jewish man is clear. I will include essential elements like obedience, faith in Jesus, and repentance, and Ill make sure to avoid casual language that undermines the seriousness of the discussion.

fresh_translation.text: One day, John the Baptist's friends, called disciples, were talking to a Jewish teacher. They were asking questions about how people can be made clean and what it means to please God. They learned that baptism is a way to show that we are sorry for our mistakes and want to follow Jesus. John the Baptist taught everyone that baptism is not only a sign of love but also a way to obey God and tell others we believe in Him.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse does not need to be rearranged with the previous verse as it stands well on its own. However, it flows contextually from the previous conversation about baptism and followers of John.

related_verses.text: They confessed their sins and were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
And so John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
The next day John was there again with two of his disciples.
Paul said, "John's baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus."
When all the people were being baptized, Jesus was baptized too. And as he was praying, heaven was opened.

translation_notes: In this updated translation, I will emphasize John's role as a teacher and forerunner to Jesus while maintaining a simple and clear message for a seven-year-old audience. I will also address the disciples' curiosity and concern about Jesus' growing popularity without using overly complex phrases. The goal is to create an engaging and educational paraphrase that reflects the essence of the original text and is easy for children to understand.

fresh_translation.text: Some of John's friends came to him and said, "Teacher, remember that man you talked about, Jesus? He is baptizing people, and everyone is going to Him! They want to learn from Him and follow God, just like you taught them. Why do you think so many people are going to Him?"

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The ideas in this verse respond directly to the concerns raised in the previous verse, but they stand well on their own without needing to merge into a range. The concepts in JHN 3:27 clarify that everything we receive comes from God, which is a response but can be understood separately.

related_verses.text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights.
Look at the birds of the air; they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of more value than they?
For who sees anything different in you? What do you have that you did not receive? If then you received it, why do you boast as if you did not receive it?
Nor is he served by human hands, as though he needed anything, since he himself gives to all mankind life and breath and everything.
And my God will supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.

translation_notes: In revising the translation, I will focus on clearly conveying the idea that all good things come from God, while maintaining an easy-to-understand language suitable for a seven-year-old. I will also incorporate the concept of divine authority and the heavenly origin of gifts without losing the relatable analogy to birthday presents. This will help link the verse back to the context of John's ministry and Jesus' growing influence among the people.

fresh_translation.text: John answered, "No one can have anything good unless it is given to them from heaven. Its like when you have a birthday party: you cant get presents unless someone decides to give them to you. God gives us the best gifts, and those gifts help us learn about Him and love Him even more!"

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The message in this verse stands alone, as it clarifies Johns role without requiring additional context from the previous verse.

related_verses.text: And this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, 'Who are you?'
This is he of whom it is written: 'Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.'
This is he of whom it is written, 'Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.'
He said, 'I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness: Make straight the way of the Lord,' as the prophet Isaiah said.
He must increase, but I must decrease.

translation_notes: To revise the translation of JHN 3:28, I will incorporate the feedback from my teachers while keeping the language simple for a seven-year-old. The goal is to clearly express John the Baptist's identity and role without losing the essence of the message. I will maintain the themes of humility and preparation for Jesus, ensuring that the special nature of Jesus as the Messiah is also highlighted.

fresh_translation.text: John the Baptist said, 'Remember, I told you that I am not the special one you are looking for. I am here to help everyone get ready for Jesus. God sent me to tell you the good news and help you understand how wonderful Jesus is, because He is our Savior, the one who can save us all!"

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The meaning of this verse builds upon the previous one, emphasizing the joy of the friend of the bridegroom. However, it is not necessary to merge them into a single verse as they convey distinct thoughts that can stand alone while still being connected.

related_verses.text: Then the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went to meet the bridegroom.
You all know that I told you, 'I am not the Christ.' I am just someone sent to tell you about Him.
Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her.
And I saw the holy city, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
And Jesus said to them, 'Can the wedding guests mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them? The days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast.'

translation_notes: In revising the translation of John 3:29, I want to ensure that the message remains simple and relatable for a seven-year-old. I will maintain the metaphors of the groom and friend, emphasizing joy and the relationship between John the Baptist and Jesus. It's important to express Johns happiness in a way that highlights his role in pointing others to Jesus while also making it engaging for a child. I will use terms like 'super happy' to simplify language and enhance relatability, ensuring that the focus on Jesus as the true Savior is clear.

fresh_translation.text: John said, 'Jesus is like a groom who really loves his bride, and I am his friend helping him get everything ready. When I hear the groom's voice, it makes me super happy! My joy is full because I get to tell everyone how special Jesus is. He is the true Savior we have all been waiting for!"

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The joy expressed in the previous verse builds up to the importance of the bridegroom's presence and role. However, JHN 3:30 stands alone as it reflects on the necessary growth of the bridegroom in contrast to the decrease of the friend. Thus, no merging is necessary, but understanding the relationship helps appreciate the context.

related_verses.text: The one who has the bride is the bridegroom. But the friend who stands and listens to him is filled with joy when he hears the bridegroom's voice. This joy of mine is now complete.
In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves.
He must become greater; I must become less.
Then he said to them all: "Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross daily and follow me."

translation_notes: I will focus on simplifying the language while maintaining the theological importance of Jesus. I need to incorporate the idea of Jesus increasing in importance while John takes a step back. I'll ensure the translation aligns with the essence of the surrounding verses and is suitable for a seven-year-old's understanding.

fresh_translation.text: Jesus should be the most important person, and I want everyone to see Him more and more! When Jesus shines brighter, it makes me really happy! I step back so that He can be in the spotlight, and that's a wonderful feeling! I want everyone to know how amazing Jesus is, and I can't wait to share the good news about Him.

related_verses.text: They were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
He said to them, 'You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.'
For I have come down from heaven, not to do my own will, but the will of him who sent me.
No one has ascended into heaven except he who descended from heaven, the Son of Man.
The officers answered, 'No one ever spoke like this man!'
And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.

translation_notes: In light of the corrections provided by my teachers, I want to enhance the clarity of Jesus's unique authority as the one who speaks from heaven. This involves using more direct language to emphasize His divine knowledge and the contrast between earthly understanding and heavenly wisdom. I will maintain the engaging tone suitable for a seven-year-old while ensuring the essence of the original text remains intact and accessible.

fresh_translation.text: Jesus is the best of all because He came from heaven! People on earth can only talk about what they see, but Jesus knows everything about God because He comes from above. Its like He has super vision that lets Him see everything clearly! He teaches us important things about Gods love, and thats why we should listen to Him and believe in Him.

related_verses.text: The Word became flesh and made his dwelling among us. We have seen his glory, the glory of the one and only Son, who came from the Father, full of grace and truth.
No one has ever seen God, but the one and only Son, who is himself God and is in closest relationship with the Father, has made him known.

Anyone who believes in the Son of God has this testimony in their heart. Anyone who does not believe God has made him out to be a liar because they have not believed the testimony God has given about his Son.
No one ever spoke the way this man does, the guards replied.
Whoever listens to you listens to me; whoever rejects you rejects me; but whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me.

I will simplify phrases, maintain the emphasis on Jesus' authority and love, and address the concerns about the potential implications of missing out on God's love. fresh_translation.text: Jesus shares with us everything He has seen and heard from God. His words are like treasures that tell us the truth. Its super important to believe in Him because He knows exactly what God wants us to understand. But some people dont pay attention to what He says and dont believe in Him. This can keep them from feeling God's love and knowing the truth He shares.

related_verses.text: But to all who did receive him, who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God.
And you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.

fresh_translation.text: When we believe what Jesus tells us, it's like saying we really trust God because He always speaks the truth. Jesus is God's Son, and He shares special messages that help us know God better. When we believe in Jesus, we not only learn about God's truth, but we also feel God's love and joy in our hearts!

fresh_translation.text: God sent Jesus to share all about His love and amazing plan. Jesus speaks God's words with authority because the Holy Spirit is always with Him. This means that we can believe everything Jesus tells us, as He shows us the truth about God and how much He loves us.

related_verses.text: And a voice from heaven said, 'This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased.'
I and the Father are one.
He who did not spare his own Son, but gave him up for us allhow will he not also, along with him, graciously give us all things?

I will include the idea that Jesus is God's only Son and that He shows us the truth about God. This needs to be relatable for a seven-year-old while maintaining important theological concepts.

fresh_translation.text: God loves Jesus, His only Son, a whole lot! He has given Jesus the power to help us because Jesus is very special. Jesus tells us all about God and shows us how to live because He is really close to God. We can trust Him completely because He knows what God wants for us.

related_verses.text: For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
Very truly I tell you, whoever hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life and will not be judged but has crossed over from death to life.
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
Whoever has the Son has life; whoever does not have the Son of God does not have life.
Jesus answered, 'I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.'

The translation must convey both the joy of eternal life with God for those who believe in Jesus and the seriousness of God's wrath for those who choose not to believe. The tone should reflect God's love and desire for relationship while maintaining theological integrity regarding judgment. I will adjust the wording to better express these concepts without losing clarity.

fresh_translation.text: If you believe in Jesus, you will have life forever with God, and thats amazing! But if you dont believe in Him, you wont see that happy life with God, and instead, you will face Gods anger because He wants us to trust Him. God loves everyone and really wants us to be happy together, just like Jesus teaches us how to live.
